intro: Cnicus rivularis subsp. allionii, commonly known as the Allion's sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features wiry stems covered with fine, soft hairs and produces small, yellow flowers with five petals. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in coastal areas, riverbanks, and disturbed soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
